name: Wetsus, European Centre of Excellence for Sustainable Water Technology
goal:
Wetsus is the coordinator of an industry driven research programme in which over 105 European and global companies actively participate. They contribute cash contributions to breakthrough research of European universities.
In 2019 70 PHD candidates linked to 20 universities and research centers in 9 EU countires were working on research projects in the Wetsus laboratory. These breakthrough research projects have already resulted in 850 highly cited research papers, 90 high value patents and 36 spin-off companies. Also the participating companies have improved their technologies and solutions, which are exported on the global market and integrated into various value chains.
Wetsus actively contributes to the development of sustainable water technology, which helps to solve Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), reduce environmental pollution, enables the circular economy, provides renewable energy and energy storage and improves the availability of clean water sources and water reuse.
interests: Climate Action, Education and training, Energy, Environment, Regional Policy, Research and innovation
euInitiatives:
Wetsus participates in Horizon2020 and Interreg projects.
Wetsus is active in EIP Water and the Steering Group of EIP Water.
Wetsus is actively involved in the water supply and sanitation technology platform (WssTP), in which it coordinates the Working Group Resource Recovery.
WaterCampus Leeuwarden, on which Wetsus is located, is active in ERRIN, European Regions Research and Innovation Network.
Wetsus is an active member of EIT Raw Materials and EIT Climate KIC.
Wetsus is active in research, education, innovation and interregional cooperation, especially in the context of RIS3.
